alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Craig, southeastern Rogers, Delaware, Mayes, northeastern Wagoner and northwestern Cherokee Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Inola, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Wagoner... Jay... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Colcord... Kansas... Adair... Bernice... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Disney... Oaks... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Peggs... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner
